title.narrative: IR 2.1 ACCES A L'EDUCATION

description.narrative: IR 2.1 : By the end of 2018, girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable and marginalized, have universal access to primary education, with a primary net rate of admission that increase from 50 % in 2010 to 75% in 2017,which contributes to Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNIVERSAL QUALITY BASIC EDUCATIONPCR 2: By the end of 2018, universal access to education, and a significant and fair increase in completion of quality primary education, supported by a life-cycle approach, will be provided to children.

related-activity.ref: 0990/A0/06/002 ÉDUCATION PRIMAIRE DE QUALITE POUR TOUS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.1 : By the end of 2018, girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable and marginalized, have universal access to primary education, with a primary net rate of admission that increase from 50 % in 2010 to 75% in 2017

description.narrative: DRC made significant progress towards universal access to primary education, with a net rate of admission that increased from 50% in 2010 to 75 % in 2019. An exceptional influx of children in schools was observed when the newly elected president abolished school fees for primary education. UNICEF provided 375,839 children with individual education and early learning materials, while advocating for the implementation of necessary follow-up measures to sustain the decision. In 2019, 1,881 adolescents (1,522 girls) benefitted from vocational training. Another 900 adolescent girls were empowered and sensitized on child marriage and early pregnancy prevention through UNICEF-supported programmes. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
